On Mar 2, 2010, at 2:03 PM, Bob Haugen wrote:

> 
> REST does not solve the problem but the REST constraints affect the
> problem.  And I don't mean in the sense of "dogmatic rules that must
> be obeyed", but in the sense that this problem will exist on the open
> Web and thus runs into the problems of coordination over an
> untrustworthy network.
> 
> So I am interested in "the best that can practically be done" rather
> than absolute uncertainty.  In those terms, compensation payments is
> not the best that can be done.  Some form of optimistic order taking
> with conflict notification seems possible.
> 
> Which will leave the problem of how to get the various sites to agree
> on the order handling procedure, which will not be easy either.

That sounds like an excellent overall target towards my RESTifying procurement exercise could evolve. If you don't mind, I'll 'steal' your use case for that :-)

I agree that the use of REST affects the problem - will chew on it.

Jan
